title: China Construction Bank Corporation (CCB) participates in EUR 200 million syndicated loan for corporate debt refinancing and working capital purposes (linked to project ID#95880 and 95883)
description: In December 2019, Ural Mining and Metallurgical Company (UMMC) — a leading Russian producer of copper, zinc and other precious metals — signed an EUR 200 million syndicated loan agreement with a group of Chinese and non-Chinese banks for corporate debt refinancing and working capital purposes. The 4-year unsecured loan facility provides for an up to EUR300 million increase option. Participants in the loan syndicate included Banca Intesa, Bank ICBC (JSC), Joint-Stock Commercial Bank “Bank of China (Russia)”, Isibasi Bank, PJSC ROSBANK, RCB Bank Ltd, China Construction Bank (Russia) Limited, AO Raiffeisenbank, and PJSC "Sovcombank”.
staff_comments: 1. UMMC operates in more than 40 companies in various industries located in different regions of Russia. It is the largest metal zinc producer in Russia and the second-largest coal producer by volume.2. The Clifford Chance served as a legal adviser for the transaction.3. The individual contributions of ICBC, Bank of China, and China Construction Bank are unknown. For the time being, AidData assumes equal contributions ($22,222,222) across the 9 known members of the loan syndicate. For ICBC's contribution see project ID#95883 and see project ID#95880 for Bank of China's contribution. 4. The deal was executed under Russian law in the standardized form for a syndicated facility agreement.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
China Construction Bank Corporation (CCB) participates in EUR 200 million syndicated loan for corporate debt refinancing and working capital purposes (linked to project ID#95880 and 95883)

# Description
In December 2019, Ural Mining and Metallurgical Company (UMMC) — a leading Russian producer of copper, zinc and other precious metals — signed an EUR 200 million syndicated loan agreement with a group of Chinese and non-Chinese banks for corporate debt refinancing and working capital purposes. The 4-year unsecured loan facility provides for an up to EUR300 million increase option. Participants in the loan syndicate included Banca Intesa, Bank ICBC (JSC), Joint-Stock Commercial Bank “Bank of China (Russia)”, Isibasi Bank, PJSC ROSBANK, RCB Bank Ltd, China Construction Bank (Russia) Limited, AO Raiffeisenbank, and PJSC "Sovcombank”.
justification: Loan supports a major producer of copper and other metals critical for energy transition, but lacks specific project details
evidence: UMMC is a leading producer of copper and zinc, both energy transition minerals, but loan purpose is general corporate financing

combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
Industrial and Commercial Bank of China participates in EUR 200 million syndicated loan for corporate debt refinancing and working capital purposes (linked to project ID#95880 and 95882)

# Description
In December 2019, Ural Mining and Metallurgical Company (UMMC) — a leading Russian producer of copper, zinc and other precious metals — signed an EUR 200 million syndicated loan agreement with a group of Chinese and non-Chinese banks for corporate debt refinancing and working capital purposes. The 4-year unsecured loan facility provides for an up to EUR300 million increase option. Participants in the loan syndicate included Banca Intesa, Bank ICBC (JSC), Joint-Stock Commercial Bank “Bank of China (Russia)”, Isibasi Bank, PJSC ROSBANK, RCB Bank Ltd, China Construction Bank (Russia) Limited, AO Raiffeisenbank, and PJSC "Sovcombank”.
justification: Project involves corporate debt refinancing and working capital purposes without specific environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Syndicated loan for corporate debt refinancing and working capital, no direct project implementation or environmental impact specified

title: China Development Bank provides EUR 74.25 million loan for LNG PHECDA Vessel (HK-5160) Acquisition Project (Linked to Project ID#95926)
description: On July 25, 2019, Arctic Orange LNG Shipping Limited — a special purpose vehicle that is legally incorporated in Hong Kong and jointly owned by MOL (Europe Africa) Ltd. (a UK-registered company) [50% equity stake] and China COSCO Shipping Corporation Limited [50% equity stake] — signed an EUR 148,500,000 syndicated facility (loan) agreement (ID#3100201901100002221) with China Development Bank and China Eximbank for the LNG PHECDA Vessel (HK-5160) Acquisition Project. MUFG Bank Ltd. served as the facility agent and account bank, while China Eximbank served as the security trustee. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that the borrower purchased a credit insurance policy from Sinosure. It is also known that the loan is secured by (i.e. collateralized against) a first priority deed of assignment of the insurances of the borrower. The purpose of the project was to facilitate the acquisition and construction of a vessel known as the LNG PHECDA Vessel (HK-5160) to service the Yamal LNG Project, which involves the construction of a liquefied natural gas (LNG) plant in Sabetta in the north-eastern part of Russia’s Yamal Peninsula (and is being financed by China Eximbank, China Development Bank, and the Silk Road Fund as captured via Project ID#67041, 67064, 67062, 67063, 67040, 67068, 67069). The LNG PHECDA vessel was meant to facilitate year-round use of the Arctic sea routes and transportation of the gas from the plant in Sabetta. Hudong-Zhonghua Shipbuilding (Group) Co., Ltd. was the contractor responsible for the construction and delivery of the vessel. The LNG PHECDA vessel naming ceremony took place on August 19, 2020 to mark the completion of the project’s construction phase.
staff_comments: 1. The registration of charge can be accessed in its entirety via https://www.dropbox.com/s/i8k0jckxocogknc/Registration%20of%20Charge%20LNG%20PHECDA.pdf?dl=0.2. AidData assumes equal contributions from each funding agency (EUR 74250000). See project ID#95927 for China Eximbank's contribution.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
China Development Bank provides EUR 74.25 million loan for LNG PHECDA Vessel (HK-5160) Acquisition Project (Linked to Project ID#95926)

# Description
On July 25, 2019, Arctic Orange LNG Shipping Limited — a special purpose vehicle that is legally incorporated in Hong Kong and jointly owned by MOL (Europe Africa) Ltd. (a UK-registered company) [50% equity stake] and China COSCO Shipping Corporation Limited [50% equity stake] — signed an EUR 148,500,000 syndicated facility (loan) agreement (ID#3100201901100002221) with China Development Bank and China Eximbank for the LNG PHECDA Vessel (HK-5160) Acquisition Project. MUFG Bank Ltd. served as the facility agent and account bank, while China Eximbank served as the security trustee. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that the borrower purchased a credit insurance policy from Sinosure. It is also known that the loan is secured by (i.e. collateralized against) a first priority deed of assignment of the insurances of the borrower. The purpose of the project was to facilitate the acquisition and construction of a vessel known as the LNG PHECDA Vessel (HK-5160) to service the Yamal LNG Project, which involves the construction of a liquefied natural gas (LNG) plant in Sabetta in the north-eastern part of Russia’s Yamal Peninsula (and is being financed by China Eximbank, China Development Bank, and the Silk Road Fund as captured via Project ID#67041, 67064, 67062, 67063, 67040, 67068, 67069). The LNG PHECDA vessel was meant to facilitate year-round use of the Arctic sea routes and transportation of the gas from the plant in Sabetta. Hudong-Zhonghua Shipbuilding (Group) Co., Ltd. was the contractor responsible for the construction and delivery of the vessel. The LNG PHECDA vessel naming ceremony took place on August 19, 2020 to mark the completion of the project’s construction phase.
justification: Project involves LNG vessel acquisition and construction to support natural gas transportation, which has a complex relationship with energy transition goals
evidence: LNG PHECDA Vessel acquisition and construction, service for Yamal LNG Project, natural gas transportation focus

title: China Development Bank provides EUR 74.45 million loan for LNG Megrez Vessel (HK-5217) Acquisition Project (Linked to Project ID#95930)

MUFG Bank Ltd. served as the facility agent and account bank, while China Eximbank served as the security trustee. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that the borrower purchased a credit insurance policy from Sinosure. It is also known that the loan is secured by (i.e. collateralized against) a first priority deed of assignment of the insurances of the borrower.   The purpose of the project was to facilitate the acquisition and construction of a vessel known as the LNG Megrez Vessel (HK-5217) to service the Yamal LNG Project, which involves the construction of a liquefied natural gas (LNG) plant in Sabetta in the north-eastern part of Russia’s Yamal Peninsula (and is being financed by China Eximbank, China Development Bank, and the Silk Road Fund as captured via Project ID#67041, 67064, 67062, 67063, 67040, 67068, 67069). title: China Development Bank provides EUR 74 million loan for LNG Merak Vessel (HK-5124) Acquisition Project (Linked to Project ID#95932)
description: On July 25, 2019, Arctic Yellow LNG Shipping Limited — a special purpose vehicle that is legally incorporated in Hong Kong and jointly owned by MOL (Europe Africa) Ltd. (a UK-registered company) [50% equity stake] and China COSCO Shipping Corporation Limited [50% equity stake] — signed an EUR 148,000,000 syndicated facility (loan) agreement (ID#3100201901100002223) with China Development Bank and China Eximbank for the LNG Merak Vessel (HK-5124) Acquisition Project. MUFG Bank Ltd. served as the facility agent and account bank, while China Eximbank served as the security trustee. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that the borrower purchased a credit insurance policy from Sinosure. It is also known that the loan is secured by (i.e. collateralized against) a first priority deed of assignment of the insurances of the borrower.   The purpose of the project was to facilitate the acquisition and construction of a vessel known as the LNG Merak Vessel (HK-5124) to service the Yamal LNG Project, which involves the construction of a liquefied natural gas (LNG) plant in Sabetta in the north-eastern part of Russia’s Yamal Peninsula (and is being financed by China Eximbank, China Development Bank, and the Silk Road Fund as captured via Project ID#67041, 67064, 67062, 67063, 67040, 67068, 67069). Hudong-Zhonghua Shipbuilding (Group) Co., Ltd. was the contractor responsible for the construction and delivery of the vessel. The LNG Merak vessel naming ceremony took place on January 8, 2020 to mark the completion of the project’s construction phase.

title: China Development Bank provides EUR 73.85 million loan for LNG Dubhe Vessel (HK-5080) Acquisition Project (Linked to Project ID#95934)
description: On July 25, 2019, rctic Red LNG Shipping Limited — a special purpose vehicle that is legally incorporated in Hong Kong and jointly owned by MOL (Europe Africa) Ltd. (a UK-registered company) [50% equity stake] and China COSCO Shipping Corporation Limited [50% equity stake] — signed an EUR 148,000,000 syndicated facility (loan) agreement (ID#3100201901100002217) with China Development Bank and China Eximbank for the LNG Dubhe Vessel (HK-5080) Acquisition Project. MUFG Bank Ltd. served as the facility agent and account bank, while China Eximbank served as the security trustee. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that the borrower purchased a credit insurance policy from Sinosure. It is also known that the loan is secured by (i.e. collateralized against) a first priority deed of assignment of the insurances of the borrower.   The purpose of the project was to facilitate the acquisition and construction of a vessel known as the LNG Dubhe Vessel (HK-5080) to service the Yamal LNG Project, which involves the construction of a liquefied natural gas (LNG) plant in Sabetta in the north-eastern part of Russia’s Yamal Peninsula (and is being financed by China Eximbank, China Development Bank, and the Silk Road Fund as captured via Project ID#67041, 67064, 67062, 67063, 67040, 67068, 67069). The LNG Dubhe vessel was meant to facilitate year-round use of the Arctic sea routes and transportation of the gas from the plant in Sabetta.   Hudong-Zhonghua Shipbuilding (Group) Co., Ltd. was the contractor responsible for the construction and delivery of the vessel. The LNG Dubhe vessel naming ceremony took place on September 24, 2019 to mark the completion of the project’s construction phase.
staff_comments: 1. The registration of charge can be accessed in its entirety via https://www.dropbox.com/s/hxhusqpig6nz6wq/Registration%20of%20Charge%20LNG%20MERAK.pdf?dl=0.2. AidData assumes equal contributions from both members in the syndicate (EUR 73.85 million) with a total value of EUR 147,700,000). See Project ID#95934 for China Eximbank's contribution.

# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
China Development Bank provides EUR 73.85 million loan for LNG Dubhe Vessel (HK-5080) Acquisition Project (Linked to Project ID#95934)

# Description
On July 25, 2019, rctic Red LNG Shipping Limited — a special purpose vehicle that is legally incorporated in Hong Kong and jointly owned by MOL (Europe Africa) Ltd. (a UK-registered company) [50% equity stake] and China COSCO Shipping Corporation Limited [50% equity stake] — signed an EUR 148,000,000 syndicated facility (loan) agreement (ID#3100201901100002217) with China Development Bank and China Eximbank for the LNG Dubhe Vessel (HK-5080) Acquisition Project. MUFG Bank Ltd. served as the facility agent and account bank, while China Eximbank served as the security trustee. The borrowing terms of the loan are unknown. However, it is known that the borrower purchased a credit insurance policy from Sinosure. It is also known that the loan is secured by (i.e. collateralized against) a first priority deed of assignment of the insurances of the borrower.   The purpose of the project was to facilitate the acquisition and construction of a vessel known as the LNG Dubhe Vessel (HK-5080) to service the Yamal LNG Project, which involves the construction of a liquefied natural gas (LNG) plant in Sabetta in the north-eastern part of Russia’s Yamal Peninsula (and is being financed by China Eximbank, China Development Bank, and the Silk Road Fund as captured via Project ID#67041, 67064, 67062, 67063, 67040, 67068, 67069). The LNG Dubhe vessel was meant to facilitate year-round use of the Arctic sea routes and transportation of the gas from the plant in Sabetta.   Hudong-Zhonghua Shipbuilding (Group) Co., Ltd. was the contractor responsible for the construction and delivery of the vessel. The LNG Dubhe vessel naming ceremony took place on September 24, 2019 to mark the completion of the project’s construction phase.
justification: Project involves acquisition of LNG vessel to support natural gas transportation, which has a complex relationship with energy transition
evidence: LNG Dubhe Vessel acquisition to service Yamal LNG Project, natural gas transportation focus
